Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very fine hotel, near Gare Saint Lazare. Very nice room, beautiful location and very quiet hotel. I would spend another time certainly in the same hotel. No parking at site, but in direct surrounding.

Reviews.Title: “Diamonds everywhere”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean hotel, diamonds everywhere, amazing rooms, most comfortable beds, close to metro, rer, and busses!

Reviews.Title: “Paris with best western”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms size, the new deco , the perfect location and the excellent service are all the ingredients for a perfect stay in central Paris . Will come back . The position of this Hotel is very good as you can walk easy the main attraction : Louvre , Champs Elysee, opera , latin quater , Musee D Orsay, etc

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a perfect location for shopping and sightseeing. Recently renovated,.it has very spacious and well finished rooms. The staff is very polite and professional. Value for money at the highest level.

Reviews.Title: “excelent hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice and big rooms, very nice decoration in the hotel. A very nice and big bed, nice bathroom with shower Also the breakfast place and the reception are very original designed with LED lighting The breakfast was also very good Not so far from la Madeleine, a good clean parking nearby in Rue de sMalesherbes We' ll come back in this hotel next time, everything was ok

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT by all means”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Highly decorated yet classy hotel + highly talented, friendly and professional staff. Great location too with free Internet! if I visit Paris again, Iwill surely stay in this hotal and I really reommend this hotel to every body :)

Reviews.Title: “Central location in a plush hotel, but some rooms facing a busy street”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two nights, excellent rooms and service but try to avoid the rooms that face a busy central Pepiniere street. Staff is very friendly and I was promptly offerred a more quiet room as the opportunity arose. The room is perhaps the best I have seen in two years of my (though unfrequent) travels in some of the European capitals.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Near the station Lazarre, near Printemps and Lafayette. Unbelievable quiet rooms, quite masculine though. Have to admit I came to sleep and I slept about 2 days. Didn´t visit buffet or didn´t sit out at yard or at beautyful lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and quiet hotel, quirky style”
Reviews.Author: Travelincomfort5
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here on a city break also visiting friends and family. Very comfortable hotel, lovely and warm despite a spell of very cold weather outside. Terrific location but also very quiet as our room overlooked the inner courtyard. Friendly, helpful and courteous staff and excellent prompt service. Interesting quirky style which added to the fun - we loved the glitter and sparkly floors. We would certainly recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: By Parisian standards a remarkably clean, comfortable room - and stylish - which did not look onto the main road outside. Staff were friendly and helpful, sorting out local bus routes etc. Lacks a good size lounge/sitting/eating area (in winter) but presumably the courtyard provides this in summer.

Reviews.Title: “I am not satisfied with the staff of hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, really good location in the center of Paris. I really like design and the style of this hotel. it was my second stay here and at this time I was totally disappointed by the staff of hotel. Check out is in 12.00 after 12.00 I had call to my room and I explained to the gay from reception that I will take one hour more and will pay for late check out. But after it I had something like attack to my room everybody was trying to enter to the room they called, it was huge panic around the situation. And in the end I had not really nice conversation on reception the gay was trying to say to me that it is not politely from my side to do like this. It was my first experience like this and it was really strange situation. After it of course I never stayed here any more.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My short business stay was surprisingly pleasant. The position a few minutes away from Galerie Lafayette is great for shopping and restaurants. I particularly liked the unusual decor of the hotel. For Paris, I feel that the value is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: PDjani
Reviews.Content: Good location, our room at 403 are small, but big enough for Paris hotel, enough space for 2 persons & 3 big suitcase. The room & bathroom are always clean, the interior are a bit eccentric, but we can appreciate it. If you need a water kettle for warm water in the room , just ask for it. Maxime at the front office are so helpful. Too bad this hotel doesn't have bell boy to carry our luggages to our rooms.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: First of all I would like to say about the location of Best Western Premier Opera Diamond. It's just perfect. Wherever you will go it takes 15 minutes. Second - it's really clear, new, modern and big rooms including wi-fi. All staff very friendly. Very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a good location. The room was quite big and of high standard. The staff were friendly and polite. The only downside was €23.00 for breakfast, but as there are a number of cafes near by this was not a major issue.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Malah
Reviews.Content: Me and my 7 month pregnant wife stayed at this lovely hotel this weekend gone. The staff were very friendly and very helpful. Loved the decor in the hotel, very chic and rooms were nice and comfortable. The location is very good, access to at least 3 different metro stations which are all linked well to get to the attractions. Lots of restaurants, cafes and many shops to spend your money... Didnt eat at the hotel as we walked to the local cafes.... Overall this weekend was amazing, and will definitely be coming back to this hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alaudio A
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in excellent location. Metro and station are 40 meters of hotel. Staff are very helpful, the hotel has very comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the location is perfect, it's in the middle off the 8e district! Metro station on the corner, a good and modern hotel, with a nice room, I like it here, it was my 4e visit, and a will come here again with plessure, room is big for Paris!

Reviews.Title: “perfect break in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sallyennis Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel in great location. would definitely go back again, staff very friendly and helpful, lots of restaurants and bars nearby, loved the hotel decor, very chic.........didnt have breakfast there as it was 23 euro, nice garden to relax in ,

Reviews.Title: “Great location in heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very quiet in the room on third floor and great location. The morning breakfast was good but a little pricey for what you got. Better to just go to Starbucks and pick up croissants from street vendor. The linen was very good and lots to walk to from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Strange decoration but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel es in a good location and the room was fine. The decoration was quite tacky, but nothing you couldn't live with. The size of the room does not seem to be adecuated for a 4 stars hotel, but that is normal in Europe. Overall, a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A night in a Diamond”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The decoration was great, the service was great as well, very comfortable rooms, nice inside garden for smokers or just to sit and chill drinking a cup of wine. Location was good, just 5-10 minutes walking to the Paris Opera, and full of shops around that area. Nice food across the street. Great time Granted.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel

Reviews.Title: ““Location, Comfort, service and Style””
Reviews.Author: platinumtravel Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many parts of the world and I can honestly say that the staff at the Premier Opera Diamond will treat you right. I was attending business and they made my stay quite enjoyable. The customer service people at this hotel are excellent, we were there for a week and every time we had contact with the staff they were excellent. I stayed in a deluxe and the room was well appointed. Cannot say enough about the bed......after a long day.......it was perfect. And the bathroom was fitted with a rain shower and plush towels. More importantly, the staff was superb and I always felt anything needed was a simply phone call away. I requested an iron and board to touch-up my shirts and within minutes it was at my door. I will certainly return to this best kept secret in Paris. Thank you to the staff for such a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location, very clean and design rooms, helpfull and very Nice stuff, they Will recommande and book very good restaurants, they are always smiling and very polite. After one day you feel like you are home, specially when sitting in the garden with Nice drink. transportation easy, one minute to gare saint lazard, you can go enywhere to Paris from there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: DiZim
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located near a metro stop with helpful staff who assisted us with directions, taxis and travel adapters! The room was very clean and spacious and even though it was overlooking the streets of Paris when the windows were closed there was no outside noise. Overall very impressed and would recommend it for anyone wanting to stay in the 8th arrondissement. Breakfast is expensive at 23E per person. The bathroom was very roomy and attractive however there was no way to stop the water from the shower going all over the bathroom floor! You just have to give up and mop up afterwards although this doesn't detract from my overall good opinion of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the weekend the Tourt de France arrived in Paris. Instead of going to our 'regular hotel', we booked Premier Opera Diamond. A great choice. A modern, trendy hotel. Hip, personal and lots of attention. Nice courtyard. Really recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: xinki Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very new and clean. Although I liked the overall theme, it was not very well executed. The proximity of the hotel to the metro sation was very convenient. It was a minute's walk away. The hotel staff were very polite and helpful, especially rebecca. She made our stay a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed for one night doing business. Comfortable and a very good location to go to La Defense by train. Bad opinion about the taxi service to leave the hotel. They can't look for a taxi at 7 am.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Australian01
Reviews.Content: Please do not get this Hotel mixed up with any other Best Western Hotel in Paris. Unfortunately, we went to another Best Western (1 Kl Away) and the Hotel was not good, the rooms were very small and the staff were below average, we quickly checked out. Luckily, I found this Hotel, it's classy and the service is excellent. The staff was always willing to assist and point us in the right direction. Rooms where up to standard. (Fridge / Safe etc..) The Hotel was clean and tidy - better than most. Breakfast was good. Close and handy to the metro Railway station. Reception Staff were outstanding. Management were exceptional. no wonder the Hotel is doing well. Close to shops and cafes. We came by train from Florence, caught a taxi from the station to the Hotel, it cost us $26.00 Euro. Taxi's will charge you an extra 1.00 Euro per bag, so don't be alamed it's common practise. 15 min. by taxi will get you to most attractions. Paris Disneyland was OK but not as good as the USA Disneyland's Finally, like with any Hotel, if you treat hotel staff the way that you would like to be treated, you'll enjoy your stay and you'll get more in return. We would definately return to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ce que je cherchais a paris”
Reviews.Author: esk0 Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was perfect & was the comfort I was looking for in Paris.I will no doubt go back to this hotel again.The staff was also very helpful & kind that sometimes you can find especially in paris hotels !! The place of the hotel was great for me as I was there for business.I took metro all the time easily with 3 minutes walk.Also great location for last minute gift buyings , 5 minute walk to Printemps & Gallerie Layette. Great location,kind & nice staff,nice & trendy decoration,renovated...a small garden & fontaine in the garden that gives you a tenderness after a long day.Perfect breakfast to begin the day when you need energy with things that you're used to find in your home.Croissant & jam is fine for the other hotels but here I was very happy to find all I look for breakfast ( of course sometimes croissant)... I hope I can find place next time I came to Paris. Congradulation to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “5 day City Break”
Reviews.Author: LBD-EK Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A lovely small hotel with contemporary decoration, if a little dark in places. An ideal location for access to the Metro and within walking distance to Place de la Concorde, Opera Garnier, Printemps etc. Superior rooms were well suited to a short stay but would have benefited from coffee-making facilities and perhaps a bigger shower room with more storage space. Although the windows overlooked the interior courtyard our room benefited from sun shining through the full length parisian balcony doors for much of the day - very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely designed, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Zoglets
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty well done design hotel. The decor is based on black and diamond sparkle. Our room was quite roomy. It faced the very nice courtyard and it was comforting to open the windows for air and hear the sounds of the fountain. The design may have gone a bit overboard when they made the showers without curtains. This would have worked had they made the opening a little narrower. Some amount of water spilled out into the bathroom. The bathroom amenities by Chopard were popular with my wife. The reception was very efficient. Wifi was very weak but then we eventually found another free signal and that worked fine. The espresso machine was a very nice service. We ordered room service once and were pleasantly surprised with the quality. It was quite expensive but I gather that was because our stay just happened to coincide with the Paris Air Show. The hotel is located just around the corner from St. Lazaire Station. There are brasseries everywhere and a Starbuck's two doors down. St. Lazaire is convenient because the RER stops there. It is just one change at North Station to CDG Airport. It was very convenient when we arrived from London on the Eurostar and faced a taxi line of what must have been over a 100 people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kmnev
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and nothing was a problem for them. All the staff were happy to help. The hotel is magnificent and well worth they stay. We extended our stay by two days. Very chic hotel, which is clean tidy and well run. The reception staff are world class. When in Paris this is a must stay!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jebbyg
Reviews.Content: With the exception of the slow check in, this hotel is wonderful. The location is great, close to metro and the train station and also walking distance to many attractions and hop on hop off bus. The rooms are a nice size for Paris, clean, comfortable and quiet. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as it was 27 euros per person. There were many small bakeries nearby (2 minute walk) and we had breakfast for 2 for 5 euros. The best croissants!! I wouold recommend this hotel wihout a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mfounds
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed in May 2010 but it wouldn't let me pick that far back. I have been meaning to write this review for a year now. To be honest I found this hotel on Trip Advisor and I feel so lucky to have found this hotel. At the time there were about 10 reviews and this hotel was not well known and I took a chance and we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel was beautiful, the room was large and the bed was comfortable. We enjoyed the free wireless internet and the nice little patio outside the bar area. The hotel workers spoke excellent English and they were more than accommodating. We actually would have a drink at the bar before we'd head out or after we'd get back and we'd hang out with them. They were so friendly and knowledgeable. One night the front desk guy even helped my boyfriend get his blackberry back that he had left in the cab on the way home from dinner. It was truly unbelievable. The only downside to this hotel was you had to keep the room key in for the lights to be on so that was a little annoying. Also - the shower doesn't have a door so the water would sort of flood the floor so you'd have to really put a stack of towels down so you didn't have a soaking wet bathroom. It was a really nice shower/bathroom though! This hotel is one block from the subway which we took everywhere and also one block from the taxi stop. We really enjoyed our stay and we would definitely recommend. When we go back to Paris we would consider staying again and the only reason we wouldn't would be to try a different part of town.

Reviews.Title: “BOUTIQUE THEMED HOTEL. LOCATION IS EVERYTHING.”
Reviews.Author: diamond_6irl
Reviews.Content: Nobody should rush choosing hotels specially if you're going to Paris. As you should make it as special as possible if you're a couple of first timers. Unfortunately this was the case for my bf and I. Had to get this hotel since our first choice wasn't available. We arrived from London via Gare du Nord. It wasn't far, 15 mins by car, charged 40€ but got ripped off since later we realised it was closer than we thought. Hotel is located in 7th Arrondissement. Streets surrounding the hotel are mainly for shopping and eating. Walking distance to lots of restaurants, cafeterias, shopping stores, couple of malls, subway station and cab service one block away. Also there's a mini Walgreens next door, a mini supermarket for those who are not familiarized with this store. ATM's nearby and one in front of hotel. Restaurants and cafeterias end up being absolutely necessary since room service starts very late. No breakfast is provided, just dinner and late night snacks, which are very pricey btw. We also found out they get the food from a retailer, that's why the no breakfast policy, the high price and slow delivery. This hotel is part of the Best Western family which is not a luxury brand kind of hotel, but honesty it exceeded my terribly low expectations. Front desk guys and service in general was ok, just polite people who limited to do their job, no smiles, nothing outstanding. Lobby decor was kinda cool and sexy. There's a tiny open area with a cool ambiance, has a cool angel fountain and a modern cocodrile decor my bf wanted to bring home :) Our room was spacious and pretty clean. Found out our bed was nothing but two single beds joined, not comfortable to sleep in, avoid the middle! Loved the rain shower, no tube though. Creepy corridors at night. Too dark in my opinion. Urges some natural light. Be aware theres no parking lot, since is a boutique hotel. Also, be aware of rooms close to the patio, people are really loud very early and staff likes to slam doors. However, our stay was pleasant after all. Location can be determinant in this type of situation. Very close to Eiffel Tower, The Louvre and Champs Élysées. Not the worse hotel in Paris, nor the best. A good choice for emergencies!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Superb value for money given that the wifi internet and breakfast were included in our EUR 248 rate for a Deluxe room: location is excellent, room was spacious by Parisian standard, breakfast buffet is small but of good quality, decoration is sleek, very nice little courtyard. Our room had a view on the courtyard, and was very silent. The hotel opened only 3 years ago, so it's still looks and feel really new. We will definitely return to this hotel next time we go back to Paris, as we really enjoyed our stay. For the same price as Hotel Duret, this is easily one or two notches up.

Reviews.Title: “WE WILL BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: bossman70
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are from Los Angeles. We went to Paris to celebrate our thirtieth anniversary and couldn't have pick a more romantic hotel! Very nice decor, clear and convinent location. The staff were so very nice to us! Very nice! It was obvious they took great pride in the hotel and always greeted us with a friendly smile and pleasant conversation. We were pleased with our room and loved the attention to design detail. The breakfast and coffee was delicious. We are already planning our next trip there. We will definitely recommend this hotel to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Spring in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying in this hotel. It was well located in terms of the metro. It was very clean and the interiors were very new. The interiors are very ornate and not really our taste, but the main thing was that they were very clean and new. We were on the second floor and on the Saturday night it was quite noisy due to a night club nearby. The other nights were fine noise wise. Our room also got quite hot, so it maybe better to stay here in seasons other than Summer as there didn't appear to be aircon in our room.

Reviews.Title: “All look and no substance”
Reviews.Author: lovetobeinparis
Reviews.Content: Let me just say that I researched for two weeks and read so many reviews for different hotels and got fooled by false claims of this hotel. They claim, they have sound proof rooms.We paid over $300/ night and hardly got any sleep due to the poor construction of this hotel. One night we heard arguments from the next room and other nights we heard noises from the above floor all hours of the night and metro noises until very late at night. We stayed on the third floor, so I can imagaine how loud lower floors are. The house keeping was a no show one day and at 9 pm, I had to call them and tell them about a no show cleaning service. The next day we got to the hotel around five and the housekeeping was standing in front of our room and we assumed the room was clean, but once again it wasn't. Another claim was a business room, but there was only one computer with fee on the side of reception desk. They provided no lotion and when I called and requested it , I never recieved it. Bathroom tissue felt like a sand paper. They went crazy with the theme diamond in the room. Bathroom was small and nice enough except for the shower. It has a great rain shower head, but the water sprayed out all the time.There is no coffee machine in the room. All in all our vacation was ruined because of all this problems and lack of sleep. I guess we should have sticked to a french hotel, not an american chain. At the prices they charge you expect much more,

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice location - right next to supermarket/train station/metro/post office - with lots of nice bistro's/brasseries nearby. Extremely convenient. The front desk and staff are limited - sometimes cleaning service doesn't get done until late afternoon - but otherwise EXCELLENT value. There is a nice courtyard in middle of the hotel that is quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “good!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Best western Premier Opera Diamond is a small cozy hotel, comfy bed, clean bathroom. The people are nice and helpful. Breakfast is pricy. location very good starbucks, a fast food shop and a supermaket just a step away!!

Reviews.Title: “never again..”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: my only comment to my stage in your hotel is the bad experience on the breakfast buffet with the reception guy .. he wanted for a coffee 23.-- €. And he explained to me.. thats the price for the buffet, but he saw that my order only the caffee was... BAD, realy BAD for your hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Return Guest”
Reviews.Author: appletonWI
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in December and returned for a 5 day visit in March. Location and staff are fantastic. Many restaurants within walking distance. WiFi is spotty in the rooms... I had issues but colleagues did not. This is the place to stay when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marleymanGlasgow
Reviews.Content: I absolutley loved this hotel - the hotel reception is stunning as you walk in and really does look like in the pics on there website, Rooms were equally stunning and again just as they look on the website my husband and I stayed here for 3 nights for our wedding anniversary we had a great stay - good location good hotel will def return. Only flaw I would mention is that as they have decorated the hotel with black the hallways are quite dark and can be hard too make you way to your room, but small flaw in a great very stylish hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Perfect location Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: CMC777
Reviews.Content: Comfortable modern rooms with free wifi and friendly staff. It has contemporary decor that is black and sparklingly dark but quite cool. A small bar for drinks before leaving or for a nightcap.. We did not dine here as there were too many better options outside.. This is the perfect hotel for the tourist in Paris. It is situated 50 metres from the St. Lazarre Metro and train station which can give you access to Versailles within 40 minutes or to the catacombs within ten. The hotel is a short walk to the main department stores and there are fantastic local restaurants and brasseries. For Paris the rooms are a reasonable size and we were able to get a good deal by advance payment saving about 70 euro a night.

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: ellekkou
Reviews.Content: Very distinctive w. unique decoration and atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but some hiccups...”
Reviews.Author: appletonWI
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location. Nice neighborhood, close to metro, shopping, restaurants, etc. About a 15 minute walk to the tourist areas. The staff was very friendly and helpful. However, there were some issues during my stay. The free WiFI internet is extremely slow and spotty in the rooms. The rooms are not well lit and for the first two nights of my stay, the lights did not work at all. The staff brought table lamps in until an electrician could be called. The other big issue, which was somewhat out of their control, related to arranging for a car to take me to the airport. Evidently, the hotel did not confirm the address with the car service and the car went to a different hotel. The staff did everything they could to get another car for me, but it was 45 minutes past when I had wanted to leave. Overall, I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in town!”
Reviews.Author: Alessandragerard
Reviews.Content: very pretty rooms, not too big, but in Paris is normal , there s a beautiful romantic garden where drink something

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: hellototravel
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Expedia and followed up with reviews on Tripadvisor. As the reviews say, it is a great value. The location was right next to the Gare St. Lazare (?) train station which also connected to the metro. (you can even go straight to Versailles from this station) The room was perfect with modern design and I think the hotel is pretty new because the furniture looked new. The only minor flaws were the large amount of dust (my husband and I are both allergic to dust) and water would run out from the showers every time we used them, creating a massive flood in the bathroom. However, the room service was quick to clean this up and our room was back to new when we would get back at night. Also, some of the concierge/receptionists were not so great in helping with dinner bookings, but we gave up and used our roaming cell phones to do it ourselves. Other than that, was a great location and had a great room for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience other than few minor nuisance...”
Reviews.Author: cagriy
Reviews.Content: I think my experience at this hotel was 5*. Front desk staff was extremely helpful and accomodating. Both hotels interior and rooms was stylish, clean and elegant. Free (and fast) wi-fi was useful. Once more if you are looking for a special night or two to stay over with someone important this is the right place. Few points I've noticed but not annoyed with are as follows, please assume rest was perfect; - In an extremely sylish room, TV was removed from it's wall stand and put on the table (well possibly it was replaced temporarily due to a fault), however, this was ruining the entire beauty of the room. Everywhere is spot on and a bare metal TV hanger on the wall with dodgy looking cables. - Extractor fan in the bathroom wasn't working. So there was a steam room inclusive. - Towel drier / rail wasn't working. - Finally, optional breakfast was extremely exprensive at a price of £23 per person. Tried once, it was delicious, clean, but not value for the money. Next door Starbucks is open even on Sundays. Once more, entire experience was pleasing, I highly recommend you booking this hotel. C

Reviews.Title: “Great find!!”
Reviews.Author: diesel230
Reviews.Content: This should be in the top 10 hotels in Paris! Me wife and I just stayed here over the weekend and loved everything from the location to the hotel itself! We booked last minute and we found the best deal from any of the other hotels we inquired from. When we checked in we were even upgraded to a bigger room! Dont let this hotel pass! The only negative thing I have to say is to be aware that if you are going to have breakfast in the hotel, the fee is 23 euros per person!! It is a good breakfast but not 46 euros worth!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, good service and location.”
Reviews.Author: LDO12102002
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel early (12pm) and thought we would be able to drop our luggage, however we were able to check in early with no problems. The room was beautiful; a good size with most of the facilities you would expect. However there was no tea/ coffee in the room, but we asked at reception for this and it was arranged immediately. All the recption staff were extremely friendly and helpful, but a particular mention should go the manageress who gave us some really useful advice about what to see and how to get there. We also took advantage of the free Wifi as phone tarifs are so expensive, again we just asked at reception and we were immediately given logon details. The hotel was in a good location, we found it easily as the station is on the same line as the gard du nord. The hotel is literally right next door to a metro station. But we found the Metro slightly confusing, so tended not to really use it. The hotel is in walking distance (half an hour) from the main sites; Arc d'triomphe, Eiffel Tower, the Louvre and really close to the main shopping area. We also used buses quite a few times and this was fairly simple. We didn't have breakfast included in our stay, but it was 23euros extra and there are a number of local cafes and patisseries which served pastries etc and also a McDonalds just down the road so we were easily able to get breakfast for less than 10euros a day. All in all we very much enjoyed our stay and would definitely return to this hotel if we returned to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice.”
Reviews.Author: jackwayne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect- beautiful room, perfect size; the bathrooms are spacious. The lobby gives a modern boutique feel. Breakfast is great. But the staff here is wonderful- from the Director Micheline, to the front of house, to the women who serve breakfast. They do their best to make you feel welcome. I highly recommend this hotel and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: topsy2
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, enjoyed the 'glitz and glamour'! We had an 'executive' room, and yes, it was a bit pricey but worth it. Spotlessly clean, very comfortable beds and good quality bed linen. Spacious bathroom, great shower and lovely white fluffy towels (would have loved a bath as well, but hey, you can't have it all)! We too were dissapointed to find no tea making facilities (apart from the esspresso machine). However we asked at reception and within no time a tea tray was delivered to out room. We would like to say a special thanks to 'Max' from reception. He was well mannered, smiling, friendly and helpfull (and his English was brilliant as well)!. Location was fine, plenty places to eat, St Lazzarre Metro 5 min walk. Small supermarket right next door and starbucks 2 doors the opposite way. Would deffinately recommend and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but at St Lazare station, not Opera Station”
Reviews.Author: mcvyger
Reviews.Content: The name of the hotel contains Opera but Opera place/station is a 10/15 minutes walk from there. This hotel is in fact near Saint-Lazare station. The street has a lot of traffic, no trees, so I can not say I like the place. But the hotel itself is ok, the room are bigger than in one another Best Western I tried not far from there. Everything is according to the Best Western level : clean room, good breakfast, efficient team...

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is awesome”
Reviews.Author: Archie_3345
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in April, the place is stunning and quirky, the location fabulously central and the staff are lovely. A*********

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful, unique, friendly luxurious hotel in the a convienent location.”
Reviews.Author: nickynooEngland
Reviews.Content: The Opera Diamond is a diamond! black glittery floors, huge sparkly lights, red crocodiles in the window. The staff could not have been more helpful, the room was lovely from its crystal studded head board to the speakers in the bathroom. When the weather is good, enjoy your drinks in the tiny but perfectly formed garden, watched by a fountain and a statue of a crocodile. The decor is luxurious and unique and yet somehow a little tongue in cheek., loved it. Go and visit, it is a short stroll from Saint Lazare and about 20mins walk from the arc de triomphe with a supermarket and starbucks literally around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in St Lazare Area”
Reviews.Author: LondonCalling_77
Reviews.Content: I go to Paris every week or so on business, but I had to travel at the last minute recently and found this little gem by accident. Clearly the place has been completely refurbished as the rooms and common parts are very stylish and clean. Low ambient lighting, lovely furnishings and a laid back atmosphere. Plus, it's exactly where I needed to stay, close to the Metro at St Lazare. Special mention for the helpful staff goes to Philippe who found me a room at midnight - I think this may be my new favourite hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Chic modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkDWUK
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a business trip with a last minute change to this hotel. This hotel is a jewel excellent location clean modern hotel particularly spacious room unlike some others I have stayed at in Paris. This is one I would certainly visit again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect boutque hotel”
Reviews.Author: cqty13
Reviews.Content: new hotel, very spacious rooms for Paris, next to St. Lazare train station and 5 minutes walking from Lafayette galeries. if you see the photos from the hotel's site, they are exactly the same in reality: large and comfortable. the beds are a dream! the bathroom is large enough and the cleaning services impecable. although they say it'a a 4 stars hotel, it's more a 3 stars one; the concierge makes all the adiacent tasks (carries the bagage, makes the coffe at the bar, opens your door when the taxi arrives..) the staff was very helpful and nice, but the hotel is defenetly a 3 stars one. TIPS: restaurants to go to: LA CANTINE, AVENUE, LE COQ, BUDDHA BAR clubs: SENSE, KONG, LE BARON BE CAREFUL: during the weekends, it is really impossible to get a taxi.. yes, in Paris... my friend and I had to walk a loooong distance because you couldn't get one; and the concierge from our hotel tried to help by calling over and over :) otherwise, Paris is fabulous! Enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Something different in good old Paris”
Reviews.Author: marcogiov
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for a weekend on Expedia at a bargain rate, I was mainly attracted by the statement that Opera Diamond had just been refurbished and it is. Too many Paris hotel rooms are too old and cramped. Opera Diamond looks like a Prada shop and hallways are darker than black, maybe the interior designer overshot a bit there, but the result is really nice, more so for a hotel 100 metres away from a Paris railway station. Accessibility is very good, at least four Metro lines at the doorstep, plus the RER E that easily takes you to Gare du Nord, where you find Eurostar trains and RER B to both CDG and ORY airports. On our arrival there was no room available for the (lowest) category we had booked, so we were upgraded to the most luxurious one. While the room was not big, it was far larger than usual for Paris. Good and wide bed, room perfectly soundproof, very nice bathroom, with Chopard toiletries. The TV inside the bathroom mirror was not working, but I didn't care. The posh bar doubles as breakfast room, but we had our breakfasts outside, it's just a few minutes walk to the Opera and Madeleine, there' s plenty of choice around. All in all Opera Diamond has been a very good experience, given the price we paid. Rack rates instead seem quite high.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Premier Opera Diamond
HotelInfo.Address: 4 Rue de la Pepiniere, 75008 Paris, France
